CatDescriptText: image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 24, 1961, pg. 2 reads: "Duquesne Brewery Employe[e]s - Augmenting his promise to employ Negroes throughout the plant, John Friday, president of the Duquesne Brewery, hired Eugene Harris and Hartwell P. Brown as bottlers, Tuesday. They are shown above, with some of the other employe[e]s.  Left to right, first row: Chan Kirk, personnel director; Dolores Walker, secretary to Mr. Kirk, and Messrs. Harris and Brown.  Back row, standing: John Nisby, salesman; Arthur C. Holloway, president of the Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League, and Dan Lee, maintenance. - Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Six men and a woman, first row left to right; Chan Kirk, Dolores Walker, Eugene Harris, and Hartwell P. Brown. Back row left to right; John Nisby, Arthur C. Holloway, and Dan Lee, gathered at table with six bottles and a can of Duquesne Beer, Duquesne sign mounted on wall
